snippet: Rebel factions in Syria are attacking each other in a series of kidnappings, killings and beheadings, as competition for recruits, weapons and the right to define the character of the future state boils over.
abstract: Rebel factions in Syria are attacking each other in a series of kidnappings, killings and beheadings, undermining the already struggling effort to topple Pres Bashar al-Assad; competition for recruits, weapons and the right to define the character of the future state are fueling the interrebel battles.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Rebel factions in Syria are attacking each other in a series of kidnappings, killings and beheadings, as competition for recruits, weapons and the right to define the character of the future state boils over.

headline.main: Syrian Rebel Infighting Undermines Anti-Assad Effort

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
